title: Mutuality of Protection
compliance: The NDA should protect the confidential information of both parties equally (mutual NDA).
preferred: Mutual NDA with symmetrical obligations for Discloser and Recipient.
red_flags: One-way NDA protecting only one party's disclosures (except narrow regulatory scenarios).
Asymmetrical confidentiality obligations.

examples.compliant: Each Party agrees to maintain the confidentiality of information disclosed by the other Party.
examples.non_compliant: Recipient shall maintain the confidentiality of Discloser's information.

title: Standard Exceptions – Prior Knowledge
compliance: Exceptions must include information already known to the Recipient before disclosure.
red_flags: Omission of prior knowledge exception.
Ambiguous drafting that weakens the prior knowledge carve-out.

examples.compliant: Information already known to Recipient without restriction prior to disclosure.
examples.non_compliant: No reference to information known by Recipient prior to disclosure.

title: Standard Exceptions – Independent Development
compliance: Exceptions must include information independently developed by Recipient without use of Confidential Information.
red_flags: Omission of independent development exception.

examples.compliant: Information independently developed by Recipient without use of Confidential Information.

title: Standard Exceptions – Third-Party Source
compliance: Exceptions must include information lawfully received from a third party without breach of obligation.
red_flags: Omission of third-party source exception.
Language limiting lawful third-party receipt unreasonably.

keywords_any: without breach of an obligation of confidentiality

examples.compliant: Information rightfully received by Recipient from a third party without restriction.
examples.non_compliant: No mention of third-party lawful sources.

title: Standard Exceptions – Public Domain
compliance: Exceptions must include information that is or becomes publicly available without fault of Recipient.
red_flags: Omission of public domain exception.
Ambiguity around 'without fault'.

examples.compliant: Information that is or becomes publicly available without breach of this Agreement.

title: Standard Exceptions – Approved in Writing
compliance: Exceptions should include information approved in writing by the Discloser for release.
red_flags: Omission of 'approved in writing' carve-out.

examples.compliant: Information approved in writing by Discloser for release.

title: Intellectual Property – No Transfer or Implied License
compliance: Ownership of IP remains with the original owner; NDA should state no transfer or implied license.
red_flags: Silence on ownership/IP.
Any grant of license beyond evaluation use.

examples.compliant: Nothing herein grants any rights or licenses by implication or otherwise.
examples.non_compliant: Recipient is granted a perpetual license to use the information.

title: Term – Minimum 12 Months Survival
compliance: Confidentiality obligations must survive for at least 12 months after termination/expiration.
red_flags: Survival period shorter than 12 months.
Obligations end upon termination of the NDA.

examples.compliant: Obligations shall survive for two (2) years following termination.
examples.non_compliant: Obligations terminate upon termination of this Agreement.

title: Term – Must Not Expire Upon Termination
compliance: Confidentiality obligations must not expire immediately upon termination of the NDA.
red_flags: Language tying confidentiality to the life of the NDA without survival.

examples.compliant: Obligations survive termination for at least 12 months.

title: Indemnities Prohibited
compliance: NDAs must not create indemnity obligations.
red_flags: Any indemnify/hold harmless language, even if 'narrow'.

examples.compliant: No indemnity obligations are created by this Agreement.
examples.non_compliant: Recipient shall indemnify Discloser for any breach.

title: Liquidated Damages / Penalties Prohibited
compliance: No monetary penalties or liquidated damages should be specified in the NDA.
red_flags: Fixed monetary penalties
Liquidated damages amounts

examples.compliant: The Parties acknowledge equitable remedies may be appropriate.
examples.non_compliant: A breach shall result in liquidated damages of $500,000.

title: Equitable Remedies Acceptable
compliance: Allowing equitable remedies (injunction, specific performance) is acceptable.

examples.compliant: Discloser shall be entitled to equitable relief, including injunction.

title: Data Protection – NDA Should Be Silent
compliance: NDA should not incorporate DPAs or GDPR-specific terms; if personal data is anticipated, address via a separate DPA.
red_flags: NDA embeds DPA/GDPR obligations.
Cross-references to a DPA within the NDA.

examples.compliant: No DPA terms included in the NDA; separate DPA to be executed if needed.
examples.non_compliant: This NDA incorporates the Company's Data Processing Agreement.

title: Non-Solicitation Not Appropriate in NDA
compliance: NDA should not contain recruiting or non-solicitation restrictions; such terms belong in commercial agreements.
red_flags: Any non-solicit or no-hire restriction within the NDA.

examples.non_compliant: Neither Party shall solicit for employment any employee of the other Party for two years.

title: Governing Law – Approved Jurisdictions Only
compliance: Governing law/jurisdiction must be one of: Delaware (DE), New York (NY), California (CA), England and Wales (UK), Singapore (SG).
preferred: NY or DE commonly preferred; others on the list acceptable.
red_flags: Any governing law outside the approved list (e.g., France, Germany, Hong Kong).

examples.compliant: This Agreement is governed by the laws of the State of New York.
examples.non_compliant: This Agreement is governed by the laws of Germany.

title: Assignment – Do Not Block Corporate Transactions
compliance: No-assignment clauses should not prevent M&A or internal restructuring.
red_flags: Absolute prohibitions on assignment without carve-outs for corporate transactions.

examples.compliant: No assignment without consent, except in connection with merger, reorganization, or sale of substantially all assets.
examples.non_compliant: Neither party may assign this Agreement under any circumstance.

title: Residual Knowledge – Should Not Be Overbroad
compliance: Confidential information should not be defined so broadly as to include residual knowledge in employees’ unaided memory.
red_flags: Definitions that capture residual knowledge learned and retained in unaided memory.

examples.compliant: This Agreement does not restrict information retained in unaided memory.
examples.non_compliant: Confidential Information includes any information retained in memory by Recipient’s personnel.
